comments:
When I try to use the ~username option on linux I get the following error

org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugException: Error initializing Mozilla browser
at org.eclipse.atf.mozilla.ide.debug.MozillaDebugPlugin.createDebuggerService(MozillaDebugPlugin.java:190)
at org.eclipse.atf.mozilla.ide.debug.internal.model.JSDebugTarget.<init>(JSDebugTarget.java:97)
at org.eclipse.atf.mozilla.ide.debug.MozillaDebugPlugin$1.run(MozillaDebugPlugin.java:234)
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.UILockListener.doPendingWork(UILockListener.java:155)
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.UISynchronizer$1.run(UISynchronizer.java:36)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:123)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:3141)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2843)
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1914)
The problem wasn't with the ~username option, but the install instruction on the ATF Web Site. If you follow the instructions, ATF doesn't run on Linux. I updated the instructions on the site.
